mods.abstract: $100 REWARD! RANAWAY from the undersigned, living on Natchitoches road, ten miles from Harrisonburg, the three following described negroes, viz.: HARMON, a negro man, aged about 40 years; black complexion, stout and heavy buily, one of his upper front teeth out. CHLOE, a woman, about 35 years of age. ELLEN, a girl, about 12 years of age, light complexion. I will give the above reward for the recovery of the three if taken out of the state and $25 if delivered to me at my residence. JAS. McCRORY. Harrisonburg, Louisiana, April 28, 1858. v4,50,tf
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
